                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Obligations on guardian of property appointed or declared by the Court

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    34. Where a guardian of the property of a ward has been appointed or declared by the Court and such guardian is not the Collector, he shall,-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	if so required by the Court, give a bond, as nearly as may be in the prescribed form, to the Judge of the Court to ensure for the benefit of the Judge for the time being, with or without sureties, as may be prescribed, engaging duly to account for what he may receive in respect of the property of the ward;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	if so required by the Court, deliver to the Court, within six months from the date of his appointment or declaration by the Court or within such other time as the Court directs, a statement of the immoveable property belonging to the ward, of the money and other moveable property which he has received on behalf of the ward up to the date of delivering the statement and of the debts due on that date to or from the ward;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	if so required by the Court, exhibit his accounts in the Court at such times and in such form as the Court from time to time directs;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(d)	if so required by the Court, pay into the Court at such time as the Court directs the balance due from him on those accounts, or so much thereof as the Court directs; and	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(e)	apply for the maintenance, education and advancement of the ward and of such persons as are dependent on him, and for the celebration of ceremonies to which the ward or any of those persons may be a party, such portion of the income of the property of the ward as the Court from time to time directs, and, if the Court so directs, the whole or any part of that property.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Suit against guardian where administration-bond was taken

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    35. Where a guardian appointed or declared by the Court has given a bond duly to account for what he may receive in respect of the property of his ward, the Court may, on application made by petition and on being satisfied that the engagement of the bond has not been kept, and upon such terms as to security, or providing that any money received be paid into the Court, or otherwise as the Court thinks fit, assign the bond to some proper person, who shall thereupon be entitled to sue on the bond in his own name as if the bond had been originally given to him instead of to the Judge of the Court and shall be entitled to recover thereon as trustee for the ward, in respect of any breach thereof. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Suit against guardian where administration-bond was not taken

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    36. (1) Where a guardian appointed or declared by the Court has not given a bond as aforesaid, any person, with the leave of the Court, may, as next friend, at any time during the continuance of the minority of the ward, and upon such terms as aforesaid, institute a suit against the guardian, or, in case of his death, against his representative, for an account of what the guardian has received in respect of the property of the ward, and may recover in the suit, as trustee for the ward, such amount as may be found to be payable by the guardian or his representative, as the case may be.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) The provisions of sub-section (1) shall, so far as they relate to a suit against a guardian, be subject to the provisions of  <span class='footnote'  title='The words, commas, figures and brackets â€œOrder XXXII, rules 1 and 4 (2), in Schedule 1 to the Code of Civil Procedure, 1908,â€ were substituted, for the words and figure â€œsection 440 of the Code of Civil Procedureâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >15</a></sup></span></span>[Order XXXII, rules 1 and 4(2), in Schedule I to the <a title='Code of Civil Procedure, 1908' href='/act-86.html'>Code of Civil Procedure, 1908</a>,] as amended by this Act. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	General liability of guardian as trustee

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    37. Nothing in either of the two last foregoing sections shall be construed to deprive a ward or his representative of any remedy against his guardian, or the representative of the guardian, which, not being expressly provided in either of those sections, any other beneficiary or his representative would have against his trustee or the representative of the trustee. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                        <p class="act-section-head text-center bd-info margin-top-20">
                            Termination of Guardianship

                            
                            
                        </p>
                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Right of survivorship among joint guardians

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    38. On the death of one of two or more joint guardians, the guardianship continues to the survivor or survivors until a further appointment is made by the Court. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Removal of guardian

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    39. The Court may, on the application of any person interested, or of its own motion, remove a guardian appointed or declared by the Court, or a guardian appointed by will or other instrument, for any of the following causes, namely:-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	for abuse of his trust;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	for continued failure to perform the duties of his trust;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	for incapacity to perform the duties of his trust;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(d)	for ill-treatment, or neglect to take proper care, of his ward;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(e)	for contumacious disregard of any provision of this Act or of any order of the Court;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(f)	for conviction of an offence implying, in the opinion of the Court, a defect of character which unfits him to be the guardian of his ward;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(g)	for having an interest adverse to the faithful performance of his duties;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(h)	for ceasing to reside within the local limits of the jurisdiction of the Court;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(i)	in the case of a guardian of the property, for bankruptcy or insolvency;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(j)	by reason of the guardianship of the guardian ceasing, or being liable to cease, under the law to which the minor is subject:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that a guardian appointed by will or other instrument, whether he has been declared under this Act or not, shall not be removed-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	for the cause mentioned in clause (g) unless the adverse interest accrued after the death of the person who appointed him, or it is shown that, that person made and maintained the appointment in ignorance of the existence of the adverse interest, or	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	for the cause mentioned in clause (h) unless such guardian has taken up such a residence as, in the opinion of the Court, renders it impracticable for him to discharge the functions of guardian.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Discharge of guardian

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    40. (1) If a guardian appointed or declared by the Court desires to resign his office, he may apply to the Court to be discharged.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) If the Court finds that there is sufficient reason for the application, it shall discharge him, and if the guardian making the application is the Collector and the Government approves of his applying to be discharged, the Court shall in any case discharge him. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Cessation of authority of guardian

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    41. (1) The powers of a guardian of the person cease-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	by his death, removal or discharge;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	by the Court of Wards assuming superintendence of the person of the ward;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	by the ward ceasing to be a minor;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(d)	in the case of a female ward, by her marriage to a husband who is not unfit to be guardian of her person or, if the guardian was appointed or declared by the Court, by her marriage to a husband who is not, in the opinion of the Court, so unfit; or,	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(e)	in the case of a ward whose father was unfit to be guardian of the person of the ward, by the father ceasing to be so or, if the father was deemed by the Court to be so unfit, by his ceasing to be so in the opinion of the Court.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) The powers of a guardian of the property cease-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	by his death, removal or discharge;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	by the Court of Wards assuming superintendence of the property of the ward; or 	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	by the ward ceasing to be a minor.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) When for any cause the powers of a guardian cease, the Court may require him or, if he is dead, his representative to deliver as it directs any property in his possession or control belonging to the ward or any accounts in his possession or control relating to any past or present property of the ward.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4) When he has delivered the property or accounts as required by the Court, the Court may declare him to be discharged from his liabilities save as regards any fraud which may subsequently be discovered.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Appointment of successor to guardian dead, discharged or removed

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    42. When a guardian appointed or declared by the Court is discharged, or, under the law to which the ward is subject, ceases to be entitled to act, or when any such guardian or a guardian appointed by will or other instrument is removed or dies, the Court, of its own motion or on application under Chapter II, may, if the ward is still a minor, appoint or declare another guardian of his person or property, or both, as the case may be. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                à¦…à¦§à§à¦¯à¦¾à§Ÿ à¦à¦° à¦¨à¦¾à¦® IV

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                SUPPLEMENTAL PROVISIONS

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                        <p class="act-section-head text-center bd-info margin-top-20">
                            

                            
                            
                        </p>
                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Orders for regulating conduct or proceedings of guardians, and enforcement of those orders

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    43. (1) The Court may, on the application of any person interested or of its own motion, make an order regulating the conduct or proceedings of any guardian appointed or declared by the Court.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) Where there are more guardians than one of a ward, and they are unable to agree upon a question affecting his welfare, any of them may apply to the Court for its direction, and the Court may make such order respecting the matter in difference as it thinks fit.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) Except where it appears that the object of making an order under sub-section (1) or sub-section (2) would be defeated by the delay, the Court shall, before making the order, direct notice of the application therefor or of the intention of the Court to make it, as the case may be, to be given, in a case under sub-section (1), to the guardian or, in a case under sub-section (2), to the guardian who has not made the application.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4) In case of disobedience to an order made under sub-section (1) or sub-section (2), the order may be enforced in the same manner as an injunction granted under  <span class='footnote'  title='The words, comma and figures â€œOrder XXXIX, rules 1 and 2â€ were substituted, for the words and figures â€œsection 492 or section 493â€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule  of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >16</a></sup></span></span>[Order XXXIX, rules 1 and 2] of the Code of Civil Procedure, in a case under sub-section (1), as if the ward were the plaintiff and the guardian were the defendant or, in a case under sub-section (2), as if the guardian who made the application were the plaintiff and the other guardian were the defendant.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(5) Except in a case under sub-section (2), nothing in this section shall apply to a Collector who is, as such, a guardian. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Penalty for removal of ward from jurisdiction

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    44. If, for the purpose or with the effect of preventing the Court from exercising its authority with respect to a ward, a guardian appointed or declared by the Court removes the ward from the limits of the jurisdiction of the Court in contravention of the provisions of section 26, he shall be liable, by order of the Court, to fine not exceeding one thousand Taka, or to imprisonment in the civil jail for a term which may extend to six months. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Penalty for contumacy

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    45. (1) In the following cases, namely:-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	if a person having the custody of a minor fails to produce him or cause him to be produced in compliance with a direction under section 12, sub-section (1), or to do his utmost to compel the minor to return to the custody of his guardian in obedience to an order under section 25, sub-section (1), or	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	if a guardian appointed or declared by the Court fails to deliver to the Court, within the time allowed by or under clause (b) of section 34, a statement required under that clause, or to exhibit accounts in compliance with a requisition under clause (c) of that section, or to pay into the Court the balance due from him on those accounts in compliance with a requisition under clause (d) of that section, or	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	if a person who has ceased to be a guardian, or the representative of such a person, fails to deliver any property or accounts in compliance with a requisition under section 41, sub-section (3),	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>the person, guardian or representative, as the case may be, shall be liable, by order of the Court, to fine not exceeding one hundred Taka, and in case of recusancy to further fine not exceeding ten Taka, for each day after the first during which the default continues, and not exceeding five hundred Taka in the aggregate, and to detention in the civil jail until he undertakes to produce the minor or cause him to be produced, or to compel his return, or to deliver the statement or to exhibit the accounts, or to pay the balance, or to deliver the property or accounts, as the case may be.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) If a person who has been released from detention on giving an undertaking under sub-section (1) fails to carry out the undertaking within the time allowed by the Court, the Court may cause him to be arrested and re-committed to the civil jail.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Reports by Collectors and Subordinate Courts

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    46. (1) The Court may call upon the Collector, or upon any Court subordinate to the Court, for a report on any matter arising in any proceeding under this Act and treat the report as evidence.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) For the purpose of preparing the report the Collector or the Judge of the Subordinate Court, as the case may be, shall make such inquiry as he deems necessary, and may for the purposes of the inquiry exercise any power of compelling the attendance of a witness to give evidence or produce a document which is conferred on a Court by the Code of Civil Procedure. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Orders appealable

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    47. An appeal shall lie to the High Court Division from an order made by a Court,-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	under section 7, appointing or declaring or refusing to appoint or declare a guardian; or	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	under section 9, sub-section (3), returning an application; or,	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	under section 25, making or refusing to make an order for the return of a ward to the custody of his guardian; or,	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(d)	under section 26, refusing leave for the removal of a ward from the limits of the jurisdiction of the Court or imposing conditions with respect thereto; or,	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(e)	under section 28 or section 29, refusing permission to a guardian to do an act referred to in the section; or, 	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(f)	under section 32, defining, restricting or extending the powers of a guardian; or,	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(g)	under section 39, removing a guardian; or,	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(h)	under section 40, refusing to discharge a guardian; or,	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(i)	under section 43 regulating the conduct or proceedings of a guardian or settling a matter in difference between joint guardians, or enforcing the order; or,	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(j)	under section 44 or section 45, imposing a penalty.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Finality of other orders

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    48. Save as provided by the last foregoing section and by  <span class='footnote'  title='The word and figure â€œsection 115â€ were substituted, for the section and figure â€œsection 622â€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >17</a></sup></span></span>[section 115] of the Code of Civil Procedure, an order made under this Act shall be final and shall not be liable to be contested by suit or otherwise. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Costs

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    49. The costs of any proceeding under this Act, including the costs of maintaining a guardian or other person in the civil jail, shall, subject to any rules made by the High Court Division under this Act, be in the discretion of the Court in which the proceeding is had. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Power of High Court Division to make rules

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    50. (1) In addition to any other power to make rules conferred expressly or impliedly by this Act, the High Court Division may from time to time make rules consistent with this Act-		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	as to the matters respecting which, and the time at which, reports should be called for from Collectors and Subordinate Courts;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	as to the allowances to be granted to, and the security to be required from, guardians, and the cases in which such allowances should be granted;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	as to the procedure to be followed with respect to applications of guardians for permission to do acts referred to in sections 28 and 29;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(d)	as to the circumstances in which such requisitions as are mentioned in clauses (a), (b), (c) and (d) of section 34 should be made;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(e)	as to the preservation of statements and accounts delivered and exhibited by guardians;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(f)	as to the inspection of those statements and accounts by persons interested;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(ff) 	as to the audit of accounts under section 34A, the class of persons who should be appointed to audit accounts, and the scales of remuneration to be granted to them;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(g)	as to the custody of money, and securities for money, belonging to wards;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(h)	as to the securities on which money belonging to wards may be invested;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(i)	as to the education of wards for whom guardians, not being Collectors, have been appointed or declared by the Court; and,		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(j)	generally, for the guidance of the Courts in carrying out the purposes of this Act.		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) Rules under clauses (a) and (i) of sub-section (1) shall not have effect until they have been approved by the Government, nor shall any rule under this section have effect until it has been published in the official Gazette.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	[Omitted]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    51. [Omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the <a title='Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973' href='/act-430.html'>Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973</a> (Act No. VIII of 1973).]

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>

<script>

        $(document).ready(function() {
            $('.test-tooltip').tooltip();
            // find tags and remove
            // remove empty p tag
            $('p').each(function () {
                var $this = $(this);
                if ($this.html().replace(/\s|&nbsp;/g, '').length == 0)
                    $this.remove();
            });


            $(document).on('click','.advancedSearch',function (event) {
                console.log(event);
                $('.advancedSearchForm').toggle("slow");
            })

            $('[data-toggle="tooltip"]').tooltip();
            String.prototype.bn_number = function(){
                var b = String (this);
                var c = b.replace(/0/g,'à§¦')
                        .replace(/1/g,'à§§')
                        .replace(/2/g,'à§¨')
                        .replace(/3/g,'à§©')
                        .replace(/4/g,'à§ª')
                        .replace(/5/g,'à§«')
                        .replace(/6/g,'à§¬')
                        .replace(/7/g,'à§­')
                        .replace(/8/g,'à§®')
                        .replace(/9/g,'à§¯');
                //console.log(c);
                return c;
            }



            String.prototype.en_number = function(){
                var b = String (this);
                var c = b.replace(/à§¦/g,'0')
                        .replace(/à§§/g,'1')
                        .replace(/à§¨/g,'2')
                        .replace(/à§©/g,'3')
                        .replace(/à§ª/g,'4')
                        .replace(/à§«/g,'5')
                        .replace(/à§¬/g,'6')
                        .replace(/à§­/g,'7')
                        .replace(/à§®/g,'8')
                        .replace(/à§¯/g,'9');
                //console.log(c);
                return c;
            }

            $(document).on("keyup","[data-td-index]",function () {

                var table = $(".table-search");
                var filter = [];

                $(this).parents("form").find("[data-td-index]").each(function (index){
                    if ($(this).val().trim()!="" && $(this).val()!=null){
                        filter.push(
                                {
                                    "bn": $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().bn_number(),
                                    "en": $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().en_number(),
                                    "td": $(this).data("td-index")
                                }
                        )
                     }
                })


                var trs = table.find("tbody tr");

                $.each(trs, function (index, tr) {
                    var rowShow = true;
                    $.each(filter, function (ind, val){
                        console.log(val);
                        var td = $(tr).find("td").get(val["td"]);
                        var text = $(td).text();

                        if (text.toUpperCase().indexOf(val["en"]) > -1
                        || text.toUpperCase().indexOf(val["bn"]) > -1){
                            rowShow = rowShow && true;
                        }else{
                            rowShow = false;
                        }
                    })
                    if (rowShow==true){
                        $(tr).show();
                    }else{
                        $(tr).hide();
                    }
                } )

            })

            $(document).on("keyup","[data-search]",function () {


                var searchContent = $(this).data("search");

                var filter1 = $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().bn_number();
                var filter2 = $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().en_number();


                var rows = $(document).find(searchContent);


                // Loop through all table rows, and hide those who don't match the search query
                for (i = 0; i < rows.length; i++) {

                    var row = rows[i];
                    if (row) {
                        if ($(row).text().toUpperCase().indexOf(filter1) > -1
                                ||$(row).text().toUpperCase().indexOf(filter2) > -1
                        ) {
                            $(row).show();
                        } else {
                            $(row).hide();
                        }
                    }
                }
            })

            $(document).find(".removableRowTable").each(function (index) {
                console.log($(this).find("tbody tr").length);
                $(this).find("tbody").each(function () {
                    if ($(this).find("tr").length<=1){
                        $(this).remove();
                    }
                })
            })


            $(document).on("reset","form",function () {

                var table = $(".table-search");
                var tr = table.find("tbody tr");
                // Loop through all table rows, and hide those who don't match the search query
                for (i = 0; i < tr.length; i++) {

                    tr[i].style.display = "";

                }
            })

        });

        $(document).ready(function($) {
            $('body').scrollToTop({
                distance: 200,
                speed: 1000,
                easing: 'linear',

                animationSpeed: 500,

                mobile: {
                    width: 768,
                    distance: 100,
                    speed: 1000,
                    easing: 'easeInOutElastic',
                    animation: 'slide',
                    animationSpeed: 200
                },

                trigger: null, // Set a custom triggering element. Can be an HTML string or jQuery object
                target: null, // Set a custom target element for scrolling to. Can be element or number
                text: '<i class="fa fa-chevron-circle-up" aria-hidden="true"></i>Top', // Text for element, can contain HTML

                skin: null,
                throttle: 250,

                namespace: 'scrollToTop'
            });
        });
        function validateForm(){
            var name=document.contactUsForm.name.value;
            var message=document.contactUsForm.message.value;
            var email=document.contactUsForm.email.value;

            if (name==null || name==""){
                alert("Name can't be blank");
                return false;
            }else if(email==null || email==""){
                alert("Email can't be blank");
                return false;
            }
            else if(message==null || message==""){
                alert("Message can't be blank");
                return false;
            }
        }

        <div class="row">

                <div class="text-center">
                    <h3>
                        The Railways Act, 1890 

                        
                        
                    </h3>
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                    
                        <h4 style="color: #fff;"> (
                            
                                
                                
                                    
                                        
                                        ACT

<script>

        $(document).ready(function() {
            $('.test-tooltip').tooltip();
            // find tags and remove
            // remove empty p tag
            $('p').each(function () {
                var $this = $(this);
                if ($this.html().replace(/\s|&nbsp;/g, '').length == 0)
                    $this.remove();
            });


            $(document).on('click','.advancedSearch',function (event) {
                console.log(event);
                $('.advancedSearchForm').toggle("slow");
            })

            $('[data-toggle="tooltip"]').tooltip();
            String.prototype.bn_number = function(){
                var b = String (this);
                var c = b.replace(/0/g,'à§¦')
                        .replace(/1/g,'à§§')
                        .replace(/2/g,'à§¨')
                        .replace(/3/g,'à§©')
                        .replace(/4/g,'à§ª')
                        .replace(/5/g,'à§«')
                        .replace(/6/g,'à§¬')
                        .replace(/7/g,'à§­')
                        .replace(/8/g,'à§®')
                        .replace(/9/g,'à§¯');
                //console.log(c);
                return c;
            }



            String.prototype.en_number = function(){
                var b = String (this);
                var c = b.replace(/à§¦/g,'0')
                        .replace(/à§§/g,'1')
                        .replace(/à§¨/g,'2')
                        .replace(/à§©/g,'3')
                        .replace(/à§ª/g,'4')
                        .replace(/à§«/g,'5')
                        .replace(/à§¬/g,'6')
                        .replace(/à§­/g,'7')
                        .replace(/à§®/g,'8')
                        .replace(/à§¯/g,'9');
                //console.log(c);
                return c;
            }

            $(document).on("keyup","[data-td-index]",function () {

                var table = $(".table-search");
                var filter = [];

                $(this).parents("form").find("[data-td-index]").each(function (index){
                    if ($(this).val().trim()!="" && $(this).val()!=null){
                        filter.push(
                                {
                                    "bn": $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().bn_number(),
                                    "en": $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().en_number(),
                                    "td": $(this).data("td-index")
                                }
                        )
                     }
                })


                var trs = table.find("tbody tr");

                $.each(trs, function (index, tr) {
                    var rowShow = true;
                    $.each(filter, function (ind, val){
                        console.log(val);
                        var td = $(tr).find("td").get(val["td"]);
                        var text = $(td).text();

                        if (text.toUpperCase().indexOf(val["en"]) > -1
                        || text.toUpperCase().indexOf(val["bn"]) > -1){
                            rowShow = rowShow && true;
                        }else{
                            rowShow = false;
                        }
                    })
                    if (rowShow==true){
                        $(tr).show();
                    }else{
                        $(tr).hide();
                    }
                } )

            })

            $(document).on("keyup","[data-search]",function () {


                var searchContent = $(this).data("search");

                var filter1 = $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().bn_number();
                var filter2 = $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().en_number();


                var rows = $(document).find(searchContent);


                // Loop through all table rows, and hide those who don't match the search query
                for (i = 0; i < rows.length; i++) {

                    var row = rows[i];
                    if (row) {
                        if ($(row).text().toUpperCase().indexOf(filter1) > -1
                                ||$(row).text().toUpperCase().indexOf(filter2) > -1
                        ) {
                            $(row).show();
                        } else {
                            $(row).hide();
                        }
                    }
                }
            })

            $(document).find(".removableRowTable").each(function (index) {
                console.log($(this).find("tbody tr").length);
                $(this).find("tbody").each(function () {
                    if ($(this).find("tr").length<=1){
                        $(this).remove();
                    }
                })
            })


            $(document).on("reset","form",function () {

                var table = $(".table-search");
                var tr = table.find("tbody tr");
                // Loop through all table rows, and hide those who don't match the search query
                for (i = 0; i < tr.length; i++) {

                    tr[i].style.display = "";

                }
            })

        });

        $(document).ready(function($) {
            $('body').scrollToTop({
                distance: 200,

                mobile: {

                    animationSpeed: 200
                },

                trigger: null, // Set a custom triggering element. Can be an HTML string or jQuery object
                target: null, // Set a custom target element for scrolling to. Can be element or number
                text: '<i class="fa fa-chevron-circle-up" aria-hidden="true"></i>Top', // Text for element, can contain HTML

                skin: null,
                throttle: 250,

                namespace: 'scrollToTop'
            });
        });
        function validateForm(){
            var name=document.contactUsForm.name.value;
            var message=document.contactUsForm.message.value;
            var email=document.contactUsForm.email.value;

            if (name==null || name==""){
                alert("Name can't be blank");
                return false;
            }else if(email==null || email==""){
                alert("Email can't be blank");
                return false;
            }
            else if(message==null || message==""){
                alert("Message can't be blank");
                return false;
            }
        }

                                <strong>
                                    <span class='footnote' href='#' title='Throughout this Act, except otherwise provided, the words â€œBangladeshâ€, â€œGovernmentâ€, â€œTakaâ€, "the railway", "The railway administration" and "the railway administration" were substituted, for the words â€œPakistanâ€, â€œProvincial Governmentâ€ or â€œCentral Governmentâ€, â€œrupeesâ€, "a railway" or "railways", "A Railway Administration" or "Every railway administration" and "railway administration" respectively by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >1</a></sup></span></span>â™£An Act to consolidate, amend and add to the law relating to the Railway.

                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                Chapter I

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Title, extent and commencement

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    1. (1) This Act may be called the Railway Act, 1890.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh and applies also to all citizens of Bangladesh, wherever they may be.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) It shall come into force on the first day of May, 1890. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>

                    2. [Repealed by the Repealing Act, 1938 (Act No. I of 1938), section 2 and Schedule.] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>

                             	Definitions

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    3. In this Act, unless there is something repugnant in the subject or context,-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	 <span class='footnote'  title='Clause (1) was omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >2</a></sup></span></span>[* * *]	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) 	â€œferryâ€ includes a bridge of boats, pontoons or rafts, a swing-bridge, a flying bridge and a temporary bridge, and the approaches to, and landing places of, a ferry:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) 	â€œinland waterâ€ means any canal, river, lake or navigable water:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4) 	the railway means the railway or any portion of the railway, for the public carriage of passengers, animals or goods, and includesï€­	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	all land within the fences or other boundary-marks indicating the limits of the land appurtenant to the railway;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	all lines of rails, sidings, or branches worked over for the purposes of, or in connection with, the railway;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	all stations, offices, warehouses, wharves, workshops, manufactories, fixed plant and machinery and other works constructed for the purposes of, or in connection with, the railway; and	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(d)	all ferries, ships, boats and rafts which are used on inland waters for the purposes of the traffic of the railway and belong to or are hired or worked by the authority administering the railway:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>   <span class='footnote'  title='Clause (5) was omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >3</a></sup></span></span>[* * *]	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div> <span class='footnote'  title='Clause (6) was substituted, for clause (6) by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >4</a></sup></span></span>[(6) â€œrailway administrationâ€ or â€œadministrationâ€ means the manager of the Bangladesh railway and includes the Government.]	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(7) 	â€œthe railway servantâ€ means any person employed by the railway administration in connection with the service of the railway:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(8) 		Inspectorâ€ means an Inspector of the railway appointed under 	this Act:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(9) 		goodsâ€ includes inanimate things of every kind:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(10) 		â€œrolling-stockâ€ includes locomotive engines, tenders, carriages, 	wagons, trucks and trollies of all kinds:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(11) 		"trafficâ€ includes rolling-stock of every description, as well as 	passengers, animals and goods:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(12) 		â€œthrough trafficâ€ means traffic which is carried over the railway 	of two or more the railway administration.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(13) 		â€œrateâ€ includes any fare, charge or other payment for the 	carriage of any passenger, animal or goods:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(14) 		â€œterminalsâ€ includes charges in respect of stations, sidings, 	wharves, depots, warehouses, cranes and other similar matters, 	and of any services rendered thereat:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(15) 		â€œpassâ€ means an authority given by the railway administration, 	or by an officer appointed by the railway administration in this 	behalf, and authorising the person to whom it is given to travel 	as a passenger on the railway gratuitously:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(16) 		â€œticketâ€ includes a single ticket, a return ticket and a season 	ticket:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(17) 		â€œmaundâ€ means a weight of three thousand two hundred tolas, 	each tola being a weight of one hundred and eighty grains Troy: 	and	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(18) 		â€œCollectorâ€ means the chief officer in charge of the land-	revenue administration of a district, and includes any officer 	specially appointed by the Government to discharge the 	functions of a Collector under this Act.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                Chapter II

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                INSPECTION OF RAILWAY

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Appointment and duties of Inspectors

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    4. (1) The Government may appoint persons, by name or by virtue of their office, to be inspectors of the railway.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) The duties of an Inspector of the railway shall be-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	to inspect the railway with a view to determine whether they are fit to be opened for the public carriage of passengers, and to report thereon to the Government as required by this Act;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	to make such periodical or other inspections of any railway or of any rolling-stock used thereon as the Government may direct;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	to make inquiry under this Act into the cause of any accident on the railway;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(d)	to perform such other duties as are imposed on him by this Act, or any other enactment for the time being in force relating to the railway.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Powers of Inspectors

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    5. An Inspector shall, for the purpose of any of the duties which he is required or authorised to perform under this Act, be deemed to be a public servant within the meaning of the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œPenal Codeâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œPakistan Penal Codeâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >5</a></sup></span></span>[Penal Code], and, subject to the control of the Government, shall for that purpose have the following powers, namely:-		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	to enter upon and inspect any railway or any rolling-stock used thereon;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	by an order in writing under his hand addressed to the railway administration, to require the attendance before him of any railway servant, and to require answers or returns to such inquiries as he thinks fit to make from such railway servant or from the railway administration;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	to require the production of  <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œtheâ€ was substituted, for the word â€œanyâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >6</a></sup></span></span>[the] book or document belonging to or in the possession or control of any railway administration  <span class='footnote'  title='The brackets and words â€œ(except a communication between a railway company and its legal advisers)â€ were omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >7</a></sup></span></span>[* * *] which it appears to him to be necessary to inspect.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Facilities to be afforded to Inspectors

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    6. The railway administration shall afford to the Inspector all reasonable facilities for performing the duties and exercising the powers imposed and conferred upon him by this Act. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                Chapter III

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                CONSTRUCTION AND MAINTENANCE OF WORKS

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Authority of railway administrations to execute all necessary works

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    7. (1) Subject to the provisions of this Act and, in the case of immoveable property not belonging to the railway administration, to the provisions of any enactment for the time being in force for the acquisition of land for public purposes 	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div> <span class='footnote'  title='The words and commas â€œand for companies, and subject also, in the case of a railway company, to the provisions of any contract between the company and the Governmentâ€ were omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >8</a></sup></span></span>[* * *] the railway administration may, for the purpose of constructing the railway or the accommodation or other works connected therewith, and notwithstanding anything in any other enactment for the time being in force,-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	make or construct in, upon, across, under or over any lands, or, any streets, hills, valleys, roads, the railway  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œor railwaysâ€ were omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >9</a></sup></span></span>[* * *] or any rivers, canals, brooks, streams or other waters, or any drains, water-pipes, gas-pipes or telegraph lines, such temporary or permanent inclined planes, arches, tunnels, culverts, embankments, aqueducts, bridges, roads, lines of the railway, ways, passages, conduits, drains, piers, cuttings and fences as the railway administration thinks proper;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	alter the course of any rivers, brooks, streams, or watercourses, for the purpose of constructing and maintaining tunnels, bridges, passages or other works over or under them, and divert or alter, as well temporarily as permanently, the course of any rivers, brooks, streams or watercourses or any roads, streets or ways, or raise or sink the level thereof, in order the more conveniently to carry them over or under or by the side or the railway, as the railway administration thinks proper;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	make drains or conduits into, through or under any lands adjoining the railway for the purpose of conveying water from or to the railway;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(d)	erect and construct such houses, warehouses, offices and other buildings, and such yards, stations, wharves, engines, machinery, apparatus and other works and conveniences as the railway administration thinks proper;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(e)	alter, repair or discontinue such buildings, works and conveniences as aforesaid or any of them and substitute others in their stead; and	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(f)	do all other acts necessary for making, maintaining, altering or repairing and using the railway.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) The exercise of the powers conferred on the railway administration by sub-section (1) shall be subject to the control of the Government.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Protection for Government property

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                     <span class='footnote'  title='Section 8A was substituted, for section 8A by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >10</a></sup></span></span>[8A. Nothing in the two last preceding sections shall authorise the doing of anything on or to any works, land or building vested in, or in possession of, the Government without its consent.] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
