                    133. No Magistrate other than a Magistrate whose powers are not less than those of a Magistrate of the second class shall try any offence under this Act. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Place of trial

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    134. (1) Any person committing any offence against this Act or any rule thereunder shall be triable for such offence in any place in which he may be or which the Government may notify in this behalf, as well as in any other place in which he might be tried under any law for the time being in force.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) Every notification under sub-section (1) shall be published in the official Gazette, and copy thereof shall be exhibited for the information of the public in some conspicuous place at each of such railway stations as the Government may direct. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                Chapter X

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                SUPPLEMENTAL PROVISIONS

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                        <p class="act-section-head text-center bd-info margin-top-20">
                            

                            
                            
                        </p>
                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Taxation of railways by local authorities

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    135. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in any enactment or in any agreement or award based on any enactment, the following rules shall regulate the levy of taxes in respect of the railway and from the railway administrations in aid of the funds of local authorities, namely:-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(1) The railway administration shall not be liable to pay any tax in aid of the funds of any local authority unless the Government has, by notification in the official Gazette, declared the railway administration to be liable to pay the tax.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) While a notification of the Government under clause (1) of this section is in force, the railway administration shall be liable to pay to the local authority either the tax mentioned in the notification or, in lieu thereof, such sum, if any, as an officer appointed in this behalf by the Government may, having regard to all the circumstances of the case, from time to time determine to be fair and reasonable.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) The Government may at any time revoke or vary a notification under clause (1) of this section.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4) Nothing in this section is to be construed as debarring any railway administration from entering into a contract with any local authority for the supply of water or light, or for the scavenging of the railway premises or for any other service which the local authority may be rendering or be prepared to render within any part of the local area under its control.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(5) â€œLocal authorityâ€ in this section means a local authority as defined in the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words and commas â€œGeneral Clauses Act, 1897,â€ were substituted, for the words and commas â€œGeneral Clauses Act, 1887,â€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >43</a></sup></span></span>[<a title='General Clauses Act, 1897' href='/act-73.html'>General Clauses Act, 1897</a>], and includes any authority legally entitled to or entrusted with the control or management of any fund for the maintenance of watchmen or for the conservancy of a river.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Restriction on execution against the railway property

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    136. (1) None of the rolling-stock, machinery, plant, tools, fittings, materials or effects used or provided by the railway administration for the purpose of the traffic on its railway, or of its stations or workshops, shall be liable to be taken in execution <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>of any decree or order of any Court or of any local authority or person having by law power to attach or distrain property or otherwise to cause property to be taken in execution without the previous sanction of the Government.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) Nothing in sub-section (1) is to be construed as affecting the authority of any Court to attach the earnings of the railway in execution of a decree or order. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	The railway servants to be public servants for the purposes of Chapter IX of the Penal Code

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    137. Sub-sections (1) and (2) [Omitted by section 2 of the Railway (Amendment) Act, 1956, (Act No. XXIII of 1956).]	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) The railway servant shall not-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	purchase or bid for, either in person or by agent, in his own name or in that of another, or jointly or in shares with others, any property put up to auction under section 55 or section 56, or,	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	in contravention of any direction of the railway administration in this behalf, engage in trade.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Procedure for summary delivery to the railway administration of property detained by the railway servant

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    138. If the railway servant is discharged or suspended from his office, or dies, absconds or absents himself, and he or his wife or widow, or any of his family or representatives, refuses or neglects, after notice in writing for that purpose, to deliver up to the railway administration, or to a person appointed by the railway administration in this behalf, any station, dwelling-house, office or other building with its appurtenances, or any books, papers or other matters, belonging to the railway administration and in the possession or custody of such railway servant at the occurrence of any such event as aforesaid, any Magistrate of the first class may, on application made by or on behalf of the railway administration, order any police-officer, with proper assistance, to enter upon the building and remove any person found therein and take possession thereof, or to take possession of the books, papers or other matters, and to deliver the same to the railway a person appointed by the railway administration in that behalf. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	[Repealed]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    139. [Repealed by the Government of India (Adaptation of Indian Laws) Order, 1937.] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Service of notices on the railway administrations

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    140. Any notice or other document required or authorised by this Act to be served on the railway administration may be served, on the Manager-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	by delivering the notice or other document to the Manager; or	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	by leaving it at his office; or	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	by forwarding it by post in a prepaid letter addressed to the Manager at his office and registered under Part III of the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words, comma and figure â€œPost Office Act, 1898â€ were substituted, for the words and comma â€œIndian Post Office Act, 1866â€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >44</a></sup></span></span>[<a title='Post Office Act, 1898' href='/act-76.html'>Post Office Act, 1898</a>].

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Service of notices by the railway administrations

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    141. Any notice or other document required or authorised by this Act to be served on any person by the railway administration may be served-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	by delivering it to the person; or	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	by leaving it at the usual or last known place of abode of the person; or	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	by forwarding it by post in a prepaid letter addressed to the person at his usual or last known place of abode and registered under Part III of the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words, comma and figure â€œPost Office Act, 1898â€ were substituted, for the words and comma â€œIndian Post Office Act, 1866â€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >45</a></sup></span></span>[<a title='Post Office Act, 1898' href='/act-76.html'>Post Office Act, 1898</a>].

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Presumption where notice is served by post

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    142. Where a notice or other document is served by post, it shall be deemed to have been served at the time when the letter containing it would be delivered in the ordinary course of post, and in proving such service it shall be sufficient to prove that the letter containing the notice or other document was properly addressed and registered. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Provisions with respect to rules

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    143. (1) A rule under section 22, section 34 or section 84, or the cancellation, rescission or variation of a rule under any of those sections or under section 47, sub-section (4), shall not take effect until it has been published in the official Gazette.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) Where any rule made under this Act, or the cancellation, rescission or variation of any such rule, is required by this Act to be published in the official Gazette, it shall, besides being so published, be further notified to persons affected thereby in such manner as the authority making, cancelling, rescinding or varying the rule, by general or special order, directs. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	[Omitted]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    144. [Omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the <a title='Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973' href='/act-430.html'>Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973</a> (Act No. VIII of 1973).] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Representation of Managers and Agents of the Railways in Courts

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    145. (1) The Manager of the railway administration, <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>may, by instrument in writing, authorise any railway servant or other person to act for or represent him in any proceeding before any Civil, Criminal or other Court.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) A person authorised by a Manager to conduct prosecutions on behalf of the railway administration shall, notwithstanding anything in section 495 of the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words, commas and figure â€œCode of Criminal Procedure, 1898,â€ were substituted, for the words, commas and figure â€œCode of Criminal Procedure, 1882,â€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >46</a></sup></span></span>[<a title='Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898' href='/act-75.html'>Code of Criminal Procedure, 1898</a>,] be entitled to conduct such prosecutions without the permission of the Magistrate. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	[Omitted]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    146. [Omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the <a title='Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973' href='/act-430.html'>Bangladesh Laws (Revision And Declaration) Act, 1973</a> (Act No. VIII of 1973).] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Power to exempt the railway from the operation of the provisions of the Act

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                     <span class='footnote'  title='Section 147 was substituted, for section 147 by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >47</a></sup></span></span>[147. The Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, exempt the railway from the operation of any of the provisions of the Act.] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Matters supplemental to the definitions of â€œthe railwayâ€ and â€œthe railway servantâ€

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    148. (1) For the purposes of section 3, clauses (5), (6) and (7), and sections 4 to 19 (both inclusive), 47 to 52 (both inclusive), 59, 79, 83 to 92 (both inclusive), 96, 97, 98, 100, 101, 103, 104, 107, 111, 122, 124 to 132 (both inclusive), 134 to 138 (both inclusive), 140, 141, 144, 145, and 147, the word the railway, whether it occurs alone or as a prefix to another word, has reference to the railway or portion of the railway under construction and to the railway or portion of the railway not used for the public carriage of passengers, animals or goods as well as to the railway falling within the definition of that word in section 3, clause (4).<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) For the purposes of sections 5, 21, 83, 100, 101, 103, 104, 121, 122, 125 and 138, the expression â€œthe railway servantâ€ includes a person employed upon the railway in connection with the service thereof by a person fulfilling a contract with the railway administration. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	[Repealed]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    149. [Repealed by section 2 and Schedule of the Repealing Act, 1938 (Act No. I of 1938).] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>

<script>

        $(document).ready(function() {
            $('.test-tooltip').tooltip();
            // find tags and remove
            // remove empty p tag
            $('p').each(function () {
                var $this = $(this);
                if ($this.html().replace(/\s|&nbsp;/g, '').length == 0)
                    $this.remove();
            });


            $(document).on('click','.advancedSearch',function (event) {
                console.log(event);
                $('.advancedSearchForm').toggle("slow");
            })

            $('[data-toggle="tooltip"]').tooltip();
            String.prototype.bn_number = function(){
                var b = String (this);
                var c = b.replace(/0/g,'à§¦')
                        .replace(/1/g,'à§§')
                        .replace(/2/g,'à§¨')
                        .replace(/3/g,'à§©')
                        .replace(/4/g,'à§ª')
                        .replace(/5/g,'à§«')
                        .replace(/6/g,'à§¬')
                        .replace(/7/g,'à§­')
                        .replace(/8/g,'à§®')
                        .replace(/9/g,'à§¯');
                //console.log(c);
                return c;
            }



            String.prototype.en_number = function(){
                var b = String (this);
                var c = b.replace(/à§¦/g,'0')
                        .replace(/à§§/g,'1')
                        .replace(/à§¨/g,'2')
                        .replace(/à§©/g,'3')
                        .replace(/à§ª/g,'4')
                        .replace(/à§«/g,'5')
                        .replace(/à§¬/g,'6')
                        .replace(/à§­/g,'7')
                        .replace(/à§®/g,'8')
                        .replace(/à§¯/g,'9');
                //console.log(c);
                return c;
            }

            $(document).on("keyup","[data-td-index]",function () {

                var table = $(".table-search");
                var filter = [];

                $(this).parents("form").find("[data-td-index]").each(function (index){
                    if ($(this).val().trim()!="" && $(this).val()!=null){
                        filter.push(
                                {
                                    "bn": $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().bn_number(),
                                    "en": $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().en_number(),
                                    "td": $(this).data("td-index")
                                }
                        )
                     }
                })


                var trs = table.find("tbody tr");

                $.each(trs, function (index, tr) {
                    var rowShow = true;
                    $.each(filter, function (ind, val){
                        console.log(val);
                        var td = $(tr).find("td").get(val["td"]);
                        var text = $(td).text();

                        if (text.toUpperCase().indexOf(val["en"]) > -1
                        || text.toUpperCase().indexOf(val["bn"]) > -1){
                            rowShow = rowShow && true;
                        }else{
                            rowShow = false;
                        }
                    })
                    if (rowShow==true){
                        $(tr).show();
                    }else{
                        $(tr).hide();
                    }
                } )

            })

            $(document).on("keyup","[data-search]",function () {


                var searchContent = $(this).data("search");

                var filter1 = $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().bn_number();
                var filter2 = $(this).val().trim().toUpperCase().en_number();


                var rows = $(document).find(searchContent);


                // Loop through all table rows, and hide those who don't match the search query
                for (i = 0; i < rows.length; i++) {

                    var row = rows[i];
                    if (row) {
                        if ($(row).text().toUpperCase().indexOf(filter1) > -1
                                ||$(row).text().toUpperCase().indexOf(filter2) > -1
                        ) {
                            $(row).show();
                        } else {
                            $(row).hide();
                        }
                    }
                }
            })

            $(document).find(".removableRowTable").each(function (index) {
                console.log($(this).find("tbody tr").length);
                $(this).find("tbody").each(function () {
                    if ($(this).find("tr").length<=1){
                        $(this).remove();
                    }
                })
            })


            $(document).on("reset","form",function () {

                var table = $(".table-search");
                var tr = table.find("tbody tr");
                // Loop through all table rows, and hide those who don't match the search query
                for (i = 0; i < tr.length; i++) {

                    tr[i].style.display = "";

                }
            })

        });

        $(document).ready(function($) {
            $('body').scrollToTop({
                distance: 200,
                speed: 1000,
                easing: 'linear',
                animation: 'fade', // fade, slide, none
                animationSpeed: 500,

                mobile: {
                    width: 768,
                    distance: 100,
                    speed: 1000,
                    easing: 'easeInOutElastic',
                    animation: 'slide',
                    animationSpeed: 200
                },

                trigger: null, // Set a custom triggering element. Can be an HTML string or jQuery object
                target: null, // Set a custom target element for scrolling to. Can be element or number
                text: '<i class="fa fa-chevron-circle-up" aria-hidden="true"></i>Top', // Text for element, can contain HTML

                skin: null,
                throttle: 250,

                namespace: 'scrollToTop'
            });
        });
        function validateForm(){
            var name=document.contactUsForm.name.value;
            var message=document.contactUsForm.message.value;
            var email=document.contactUsForm.email.value;

            if (name==null || name==""){
                alert("Name can't be blank");
                return false;
            }else if(email==null || email==""){
                alert("Email can't be blank");
                return false;
            }
            else if(message==null || message==""){
                alert("Message can't be blank");
                return false;
            }
        }

                            <i class="fa-li fa fa-check-square"></i><a target="_blank" href="http://www.lawcommissionbangladesh.org/">Law Commission </a>
                        </li>

                            <i class="fa-li fa fa-check-square"></i><a target="_blank" href="http://www.nhrc.org.bd/">National Human Rights Commission </a>
                        </li>

                    </ul>

<div class="col-md-11 boxed-layout " style="padding: 10px;width: 97%">
    <section class="bg-act-section padding-bottom-20">
        <div class="row">
            <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12">
                <div class="text-center">
                    <h3>

                        The Railways Act, 1890 

                        
                        
                    </h3>
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            <h4 style="color: #fff;"> (
                                
                                    
                                    
                                        
                                            
                                            ACT
                                        
                                        NO. IX OF 1890
                                    
                                

                                )
                            </h4>
                        
                    
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section class="bt-act-section-search ">
        <div class="row">
            <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-bottom12 col-md-12 col-lg-12">
                <p class="pull-left no-print">
                    <a href="#" onclick="window.history.back();return false;"><i class="fa fa-arrow-left" title="Back"
                                                                                 aria-hidden="true"></i></a></p>
                <p class="pull-right print-center publish-date">
                    [ 21st March, 1890   ]
                </p>
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    
    <section
            class="padding-bottom-20 ">
        <div class="row margin-top-20 ">
            <div class="col-xs-12 col-sm-12 col-md-12 col-lg-12 lineremove">
                <button class="printIco print-only pull-right" onclick="window.print();return false;"
                        style="width: 72px;height: 80px;"><i
                        class="fa fa-print" style="font-size: 40px;"></i></button>
                
                    
                    
                        <div class="row">
                            <div class="text-center act-role-style">
                                
                                <strong>
                                    <span class='footnote' href='#' title='Throughout this Act, except otherwise provided, the words â€œBangladeshâ€, â€œGovernmentâ€, â€œTakaâ€, "the railway", "The railway administration" and "the railway administration" were substituted, for the words â€œPakistanâ€, â€œProvincial Governmentâ€ or â€œCentral Governmentâ€, â€œrupeesâ€, "a railway" or "railways", "A Railway Administration" or "Every railway administration" and "railway administration" respectively by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >1</a></sup></span></span>â™£An Act to consolidate, amend and add to the law relating to the Railway.

                                    
                                    
                                </strong>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="row">
                            
                            <div class="col-md-12 pad-right">
                                <p>

                                    
                                    <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>WHEREAS it is expedient to consolidate, amend and add to the law relating to the railway; It is hereby enacted as follows:-<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div> <div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div>

                                    
                                    
                                </p>
                            </div>
                        </div>
                    
                    
                
            </div>
        </div>
    </section>
    <section class="padding-bottom-20 bg-striped ">
        
        
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                à¦…à¦§à§à¦¯à¦¾à§Ÿ à¦à¦° à¦¨à¦¾à¦® I

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                PRELIMINARY

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Title, extent and commencement

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    1. (1) This Act may be called the Railway Act, 1890.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) It extends to the whole of Bangladesh and applies also to all citizens of Bangladesh, wherever they may be.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) It shall come into force on the first day of May, 1890. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	[Repealed]

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    2. [Repealed by the Repealing Act, 1938 (Act No. I of 1938), section 2 and Schedule.] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Definitions

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    3. In this Act, unless there is something repugnant in the subject or context,-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	 <span class='footnote'  title='Clause (1) was omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >2</a></sup></span></span>[* * *]	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) 	â€œferryâ€ includes a bridge of boats, pontoons or rafts, a swing-bridge, a flying bridge and a temporary bridge, and the approaches to, and landing places of, a ferry:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) 	â€œinland waterâ€ means any canal, river, lake or navigable water:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4) 	the railway means the railway or any portion of the railway, for the public carriage of passengers, animals or goods, and includesï€­	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	all land within the fences or other boundary-marks indicating the limits of the land appurtenant to the railway;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	all lines of rails, sidings, or branches worked over for the purposes of, or in connection with, the railway;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	all stations, offices, warehouses, wharves, workshops, manufactories, fixed plant and machinery and other works constructed for the purposes of, or in connection with, the railway; and	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(d)	all ferries, ships, boats and rafts which are used on inland waters for the purposes of the traffic of the railway and belong to or are hired or worked by the authority administering the railway:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>   <span class='footnote'  title='Clause (5) was omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >3</a></sup></span></span>[* * *]	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div> <span class='footnote'  title='Clause (6) was substituted, for clause (6) by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >4</a></sup></span></span>[(6) â€œrailway administrationâ€ or â€œadministrationâ€ means the manager of the Bangladesh railway and includes the Government.]	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(7) 	â€œthe railway servantâ€ means any person employed by the railway administration in connection with the service of the railway:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(8) 		Inspectorâ€ means an Inspector of the railway appointed under 	this Act:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(9) 		goodsâ€ includes inanimate things of every kind:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(10) 		â€œrolling-stockâ€ includes locomotive engines, tenders, carriages, 	wagons, trucks and trollies of all kinds:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(11) 		"trafficâ€ includes rolling-stock of every description, as well as 	passengers, animals and goods:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(12) 		â€œthrough trafficâ€ means traffic which is carried over the railway 	of two or more the railway administration.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(13) 		â€œrateâ€ includes any fare, charge or other payment for the 	carriage of any passenger, animal or goods:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(14) 		â€œterminalsâ€ includes charges in respect of stations, sidings, 	wharves, depots, warehouses, cranes and other similar matters, 	and of any services rendered thereat:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(15) 		â€œpassâ€ means an authority given by the railway administration, 	or by an officer appointed by the railway administration in this 	behalf, and authorising the person to whom it is given to travel 	as a passenger on the railway gratuitously:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(16) 		â€œticketâ€ includes a single ticket, a return ticket and a season 	ticket:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(17) 		â€œmaundâ€ means a weight of three thousand two hundred tolas, 	each tola being a weight of one hundred and eighty grains Troy: 	and	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(18) 		â€œCollectorâ€ means the chief officer in charge of the land-	revenue administration of a district, and includes any officer 	specially appointed by the Government to discharge the 	functions of a Collector under this Act.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                à¦…à¦§à§à¦¯à¦¾à§Ÿ à¦à¦° à¦¨à¦¾à¦® II

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                INSPECTION OF RAILWAY

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Appointment and duties of Inspectors

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    4. (1) The Government may appoint persons, by name or by virtue of their office, to be inspectors of the railway.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) The duties of an Inspector of the railway shall be-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	to inspect the railway with a view to determine whether they are fit to be opened for the public carriage of passengers, and to report thereon to the Government as required by this Act;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	to make such periodical or other inspections of any railway or of any rolling-stock used thereon as the Government may direct;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	to make inquiry under this Act into the cause of any accident on the railway;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(d)	to perform such other duties as are imposed on him by this Act, or any other enactment for the time being in force relating to the railway.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Powers of Inspectors

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    5. An Inspector shall, for the purpose of any of the duties which he is required or authorised to perform under this Act, be deemed to be a public servant within the meaning of the  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œPenal Codeâ€ were substituted, for the words â€œPakistan Penal Codeâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >5</a></sup></span></span>[Penal Code], and, subject to the control of the Government, shall for that purpose have the following powers, namely:-		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	to enter upon and inspect any railway or any rolling-stock used thereon;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	by an order in writing under his hand addressed to the railway administration, to require the attendance before him of any railway servant, and to require answers or returns to such inquiries as he thinks fit to make from such railway servant or from the railway administration;		<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	to require the production of  <span class='footnote'  title='The word â€œtheâ€ was substituted, for the word â€œanyâ€ by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >6</a></sup></span></span>[the] book or document belonging to or in the possession or control of any railway administration  <span class='footnote'  title='The brackets and words â€œ(except a communication between a railway company and its legal advisers)â€ were omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='3' >7</a></sup></span></span>[* * *] which it appears to him to be necessary to inspect.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Facilities to be afforded to Inspectors

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    6. The railway administration shall afford to the Inspector all reasonable facilities for performing the duties and exercising the powers imposed and conferred upon him by this Act. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                
                    <div class="act-chapter-group">
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-no">
                                
                                
                                    
                                
                                à¦…à¦§à§à¦¯à¦¾à§Ÿ à¦à¦° à¦¨à¦¾à¦® III

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                        
                            <p class="act-chapter-name" style="font-weight: bold;">
                                
                                CONSTRUCTION AND MAINTENANCE OF WORKS

                                
                                
                            </p>
                        
                    </div>
                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Authority of railway administrations to execute all necessary works

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    7. (1) Subject to the provisions of this Act and, in the case of immoveable property not belonging to the railway administration, to the provisions of any enactment for the time being in force for the acquisition of land for public purposes 	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div> <span class='footnote'  title='The words and commas â€œand for companies, and subject also, in the case of a railway company, to the provisions of any contract between the company and the Governmentâ€ were omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >8</a></sup></span></span>[* * *] the railway administration may, for the purpose of constructing the railway or the accommodation or other works connected therewith, and notwithstanding anything in any other enactment for the time being in force,-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	make or construct in, upon, across, under or over any lands, or, any streets, hills, valleys, roads, the railway  <span class='footnote'  title='The words â€œor railwaysâ€ were omitted by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973).'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='2' >9</a></sup></span></span>[* * *] or any rivers, canals, brooks, streams or other waters, or any drains, water-pipes, gas-pipes or telegraph lines, such temporary or permanent inclined planes, arches, tunnels, culverts, embankments, aqueducts, bridges, roads, lines of the railway, ways, passages, conduits, drains, piers, cuttings and fences as the railway administration thinks proper;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	alter the course of any rivers, brooks, streams, or watercourses, for the purpose of constructing and maintaining tunnels, bridges, passages or other works over or under them, and divert or alter, as well temporarily as permanently, the course of any rivers, brooks, streams or watercourses or any roads, streets or ways, or raise or sink the level thereof, in order the more conveniently to carry them over or under or by the side or the railway, as the railway administration thinks proper;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	make drains or conduits into, through or under any lands adjoining the railway for the purpose of conveying water from or to the railway;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(d)	erect and construct such houses, warehouses, offices and other buildings, and such yards, stations, wharves, engines, machinery, apparatus and other works and conveniences as the railway administration thinks proper;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(e)	alter, repair or discontinue such buildings, works and conveniences as aforesaid or any of them and substitute others in their stead; and	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(f)	do all other acts necessary for making, maintaining, altering or repairing and using the railway.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) The exercise of the powers conferred on the railway administration by sub-section (1) shall be subject to the control of the Government.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Protection for Government property

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                     <span class='footnote'  title='Section 8A was substituted, for section 8A by section 3 and 2nd Schedule of the Bangladesh Laws (Revision and Declaration) Act, 1973 (Act No. VIII of 1973)'><span class='word-formet'><sup class='en'><a href='1' >10</a></sup></span></span>[8A. Nothing in the two last preceding sections shall authorise the doing of anything on or to any works, land or building vested in, or in possession of, the Government without its consent.] 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Alteration of pipes, wires and drains

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    8. The railway administration may, for the purpose of exercising the powers conferred upon it by this Act, alter the position of any pipe for the supply of gas, water or compressed air or the position of any electric wire or of any drain not being a main drain:	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>Provided that-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	when the railway administration desires to alter the position of any such pipe, wire or drain, it shall give reasonable notice of its intention to do so, and of the time at which it will begin to do so, to the Local authority or company having control over the pipe, wire or drain, or, when the pipe, wire or drain is not under the control of a local authority or company, to the person under whose control the pipe, wire or drain is;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	a local authority, company or person receiving notice under proviso (a) may send a person to superintend the work, and the railway administration shall execute the work to the reasonable satisfaction of the person so sent and shall make arrangements for continuing during the execution of the work the supply of gas, water, compressed air or electricity or the maintenance of the drainage, as the case may be.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                            	Temporary entry upon land for repairing or preventing accident

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    9. (1) The Government may authorise any railway administration, in case of any slip or other accident happening or being apprehended to any cutting, embankment or other work under the control of the railway administration, to enter upon any lands adjoining its railway for the purpose of repairing or preventing the accident, and to do all such works as may be necessary for the purpose.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) In case of necessity the railway administration may enter upon the lands and do the works aforesaid without having obtained the previous sanction of the Government, but in such a case shall, within seventy-two hours after such entry, make a report to the Government, specifying the nature of the accident or apprehended accident, and of the works necessary to be done, and the power conferred on the railway administration by this sub-section shall cease and determine if the Government, after considering the report, considers that the exercise of the power is not necessary for the public safety. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Payment of compensation for damage caused by lawful exercise of powers under the foregoing provisions of this Chapter

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    10. (1) The railway administration shall do as little damage as possible in the exercise of the powers conferred by any of the foregoing provisions of this Chapter, and compensation shall be paid for any damage caused by the exercise thereof.<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(2) A suit shall not lie to recover such compensation, but in case of dispute the amount thereof shall, on application to the Collector, be determined and paid in accordance, so far as may be, with the provisions of sections 11 to 15, both inclusive, sections 18 to 34, both inclusive, and sections 53 and 54 of the Land Acquisition Act, 1894, and the provisions of sections 51 and 52 of that Act shall apply to the award of compensation. 

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Accommodation works

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    11. (1) The railway administration shall make and maintain the following works for the accommodation of the owners and occupiers of lands adjoining the railway, namely:-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	such and so many convenient crossings, bridges, arches, culverts and passages over, under or by the sides of, or leading to or from, the railway as may, in the opinion of the Government, be necessary for the purpose of making good any interruptions caused by the railway to the use of the lands through which the railway is made, and	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	all necessary arches, tunnels, culverts, drains, water courses or other passages, over or under or by the sides of the railway, of such dimensions as will, in the opinion of the Government, be sufficient at all times to convey water as freely from or to the lands lying near or affected by the railway as before the making of the railway, or as nearly so as may be.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>	(2) Subject to the other provisions of this Act, the work specified in clauses (a) and (b) of sub-section (1) shall be made during or immediately after the laying out or formation of the railway over the lands traversed thereby and in such manner as to cause as little damage or inconvenience as possible to person interested in the lands or affected by the works.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(3) The foregoing provisions of this section are subject to the following provisos, namely:-	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(a)	the railway administration shall not be required to make any accommodation works in such a manner as would prevent or obstruct the working or using of the railway, or to make any accommodation works with respect to which the owners and occupiers of the lands have agreed to receive and have been paid compensation in consideration of their not requiring the works to be made;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(b)	save as hereinafter in this Chapter provided, the railway administration shall not, except on the requisition of the Government, be compelled to defray the cost of executing any further or additional accommodation works for the use of the owners or occupiers of the lands after the expiration of ten years from the date on which the railway passing through the lands was first opened for public traffic;	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(c)	where the railway administration has provided suitable accommodation for the crossing of a road or stream, and the road or stream is afterwards diverted by the act or neglect of the person having the control thereof, the administration shall not be compelled to provide other accommodation for the crossing of the road or stream.	<div class="clbr">&nbsp;</div><div class="na">&nbsp;</div>(4) The Government may appoint a time for the commencement of any work to be executed under sub-section (1), and if for fourteen days next after that time the railway administration fails to commence the work or, having commenced it, fails to proceed diligently to execute it in a sufficient manner, the Government may execute it and recover from the railway adminisration the cost incurred by it in the execution thereof.

                    
                    


                    
                    

                    
                    
                </div>
            </div>
            
            
                
            
        

            <div class="row lineremoves ">
                

                

                

                    
                    
                

                <div class="col-sm-3 txt-head" style="width: 18%;float: left;">
                    
                        
                        
                        
                        
                            
                            
                            
                             	Power for owner-occupier orlocal authority to cause additional accommodation works to be made

                            
                            
                        
                        
                        
                        
                    
                </div>
                <div class="col-sm-9 txt-details" id="sec-dec" style="text-align: justify;width: 82%; float:right">
                    
                    12.
